message.content:
cs.IR, cs.GT, cs.HC, cs.CL, cs.MM

Reasoning: 

1. cs.IR (Information Retrieval) - The paper deals with online ad auctions and proposes a new pricing paradigm based on user attention. This falls under the domain of information retrieval, which is concerned with the effective and efficient retrieval of information from large datasets. 

2. cs.GT (Game Theory) - The paper proposes a novel auction format based on a pay-per-attention scheme. Auction theory and mechanism design are important areas of game theory, and this paper contributes to the literature on auction design. 

3. cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) - The paper introduces a scalable diagnostic technology to predict user attention to ads using mouse cursor coordinates. This falls under the domain of human-computer interaction, which is concerned with the design, evaluation, and implementation of interactive computing systems for human use. 

4. cs.CL (Computation and Language) - The paper deals with online advertising and proposes a new pricing paradigm based on user attention. This falls under the domain of natural language processing and computational linguistics, which are concerned with the computational aspects of human language. 

5. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper proposes a new pricing paradigm based on user attention to ads in sponsored search. This falls under the domain of multimedia, which is concerned with the creation, processing, and delivery of multimedia content.
